text: Rosalind Toy "Roz" McGee (née Johnson; August 16, 1937 - June 16, 2015) was a community activist and legislator. Born in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, McGee went to Agnes Scott College and then received her bachelor's degree from University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. McGee was active in several communities where she, her husband Zell, and the family had lived. McGee lived in Salt Lake City, Utah was executive director for Utah Voices for Children. From 2003 to 2008, McGee served in the Utah House of Representatives and was a Democrat. McGee died in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.Rosalind McGee- obituaryFormer Utah House member diesHistorical Listing of Utah State Legislators ==Notes== Category:1937 births Category:2015 deaths Category:People from Chapel Hill, North Carolina Category:Politicians from Salt Lake City Category:Agnes Scott College alumni Category:University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill alumni Category:Utah Democrats Category:Women state legislators in Utah Category:Members of the Utah House of Representatives Category:21st-century American politicians Category:21st- century American women politicians
title: Rosalind McGee
